command.name: Help
command.extra: Floating tasks: Tasks which have no time component.
Deadline tasks: Tasks which have one time as deadline.
Timed tasks: Tasks which have a start and end time.
For command-line users, you are advised to call a list/refresh operation after every change to the database.

command.name: Add
command.usage: a hand in homework by Monday 6pm (a is a shortcut for add)
command.extra: If DoIt misinterprets the task name as the time, put inverted commas around "task name":
add "read book from page 1000 to 1100" by Friday.

command.name: List
command.summary: Shows the list of tasks in your schedule
command.usage: ls undone floating (Floating tasks that are incomplete)
l overdue (Tasks that have passed the current moment and are incomplete)

command.name: Edit
command.usage: edit 1 -name go home (Change name of task at index 1 to "go home")
edit 10 -deadline today 6pm (Change deadline of task 10 to 6pm today. Will convert to deadline task if not previously.)
edit 2 -start 3pm 5 sept -end 4pm 6 sept (Change start and end times of timed tasks)
command.extra: To maximise DoIT's chances in correctly updating your task, try to change one parameter at a time.

command.name: Delete
command.usage: del over (Delete all tasks before this moment)
d all (Deletes EACH AND EVERY task in your schedule)

command.name: Done
command.summary: Marks the task specified by index as done.
command.extra: Obtain the "index" number from the list. "index" will be based on last shown list.

command.name: Undone
command.summary: Marks the task specified by index as undone.
command.extra: Obtain the "index" number from the list. "index" will be based on last shown list.

command.name: Undo
command.summary: Undos the last change you made to the database.
command.extra: DoIT supports up to 1000 undo steps

command.name: Refresh
command.summary: Refreshes your list base on latest, list, sort and search parameters.
command.extra: This command has no effect in the graphical interface.

command.name: Sort
command.summary: Sorts the current list of tasks
command.extra: Add "reverse" parameter to sort by descending order instead.
Only up to 1 parameter except "reverse" is allowed. Default is sort by start/deadline.
Does not work for calendar mode in graphical interface.

command.name: Postpone
command.usage: postpone 1 3 hours (postpones task at index 1 by 3 hours)
command.extra: This command has no effect on floating tasks. Start and End times for timed tasks will shift together.

command.name: Search
command.summary: Search for task(s) based on keywords
command.usage: search birthday (search for tasks with birthday in description)
search birthday family (search for tasks with "birthday" and "family" in description)
command.extra: The keyword search is case-insensitive. Time range search is not supported yet.

command.name: Exit
command.extra: All undo steps will be lost when DoIT quits.
